data.title: 10 Best Hair Oils for Growth and Thickness + Ways to Use Them
data.meta_description: Embrace the journey to luxurious locks! Explore the 10 best hair oils for growth and learn how to integrate them into your routine for thicker, more beautiful hair!
data.text:
Growing long, beautiful locks is every woman’s dream. Likely, you’ve seen countless videos across social platforms about the benefits of hair oil.. But with so many to choose from, how do you know which hair oils are best for growth and thickness?

No need to waste time trying to get down to the bottom of it! Today, we’re taking a deep dive into the best hair oils for growth and thickness… and how to use them!

Which Oil Is Best for Hair Growth and Thickness?

There are 10 hair oils that really stand out when it comes to growing longer, thicker locks. So, which hair oil is best for growth and thickness? Each one has unique properties that offer different benefits. Let’s take a look!

1. Argan Oil

Argan oil is one of the best hair oils for growth. That is because it is incredibly rich in Vitamin E and fatty acids. Vitamin E is a powerful antioxidant that helps protect the hair from free radicals and damaging environmental factors.

Argan oil helps both protect our hair and also promote a healthy scalp. The fatty acids in argan oil also help to improve hair elasticity which prevents breakage and split ends. Elasticity is crucial when we’re trying to grow longer, healthier hair.

2. Coconut Oil

Coconut oil is an ideal choice for hair growth thanks to its ability to penetrate the hair shaft and reduce protein loss while adding extra moisture. It allows the cuticles to absorb nutrients more easily, which leads to stronger strands.

But one of the most important aspects of coconut oil is the lauric acid. Lauric acid has antifungal properties that fight hair issues like dandruff and a flaky scalp. This leads to, ultimately, a healthier scalp. Those who incorporate coconut oil into their haircare routine will notice visibly softer and shinier hair.

3. Rosemary Oil

Rosemary oil doesn’t get as much attention as some of our other recommendations but has become increasingly popular. And for good reason! Rosemary oil has been scientifically proven to stimulate hair growth from the base of the hair follicle.

Like coconut oil, it also has the ability to address dandruff concerns and promote a healthier scalp, which is essential for healthy hair growth. But one of the most interesting properties is that it has the potential to prevent any premature gray hairs. This is because it inhibits the production of a hormone called DHT. DHT is often associated with hair thinning and premature gray hair.

4. Jojoba Oil

You may not have heard of this oil before, but Jojoba oil comes from the seeds of the Jojoba plant. The interesting part of jojoba oil is that it mimics the same oil we produce naturally. Incorporating jojoba oil into your routine leaves you with hair that feels moisturized hair but not greasy.

Because of this result, jojoba hair oil is great for preventing breakage and split ends when you’re trying to grow out your hair.

5. Olive Oil

The benefits of olive oil for healthy hair oil shouldn’t be underestimated. Olive oil is incredibly rich in Omega 3’s and other important fatty acids with strong antioxidant benefits. This leaves our hair stronger and better protected against environmental debris and damage.

Olive oil can also be a quick and easy fix when your hair is feeling dull. It instantly adds shine and moisture, which is why it also prevents breakage.

6. Castor Oil

Castor oil has something unique to offer! This oil contains ricinoleic acid, which has a direct impact on hair growth. This acid promotes blood flow and circulation, so upon massaging it in, hair growth is stimulated in that area.

As a double benefit, the blood circulation produced by massaging the oil into your scalp further promotes growth and a stronger hair shaft as the nutrients are absorbed right at the base. As a cherry on top, it also helps combat tough scalp conditions such as dandruff!

7. Almond Oil

Almond oil is sweet and can leave a soft scent, but it does much more than that. High levels of Vitamin E work to nourish and strengthen the hair. When you apply Vitamin E directly onto the scalp with an oil such as almond oil, you’ll notice reduced hair fall leading to thicker hair.

8. Avocado Oil

Avocado oil is great for anyone who feels like their hair is constantly tangled and knotted. It’s rich in monounsaturated fats, which is a superpower for nourishing and softening the hair. For those who have more coarse or drier hair, avocado oil is a great addition.

9. Grapeseed Oil

Grapeseed oil is every girl’s best friend because it’s a lightweight solution for all hair types. It’s rich in antioxidants that promote overall hair health and score 10s around the board. One of the best things about this particular hair oil is that it helps reduce frizz in staticky or humid climates.

10. Tea Tree Oil

Last but certainly not least on our list is tea tree oil. Tea tree oil is known for its calming and soothing effects, and it’s no different for our scalp. The power of tea tree oil lies in its ability to unclog the scalp and stimulate growth. This leaves us with a healthy scalp that is free of dandruff and other debris.

Ways to Use Hair Oil for Growth and Thickness
